content.description: This route starts sitting underneath the south face with one hand in a deep (really deep) two or three finger pocket and the other hand on the right corner. From this position, the feet are low on the right. Pull up and bump to the sharp holds on top of the corner. Then get a deep toe hook in the pocket beyond (left) of the two finger pocket. Reach up high (and get a little higher smear if you're my height) to rounded good hold on the middle of the face. Set a heel hook on the right (top of the corner). Find good edge (back left) just under the top, and top out.
content.protection: A pad is a good idea. There is a rocky landing.
content.location: It is around the corner from the crimper face.

content.description:
Sit start on the left pocket low on the face. Make a big move up and left to a right-facing, diagonal rail or a small 1/2 pad crimp. Work up feet and make a big move out right to a sloping pinch. From here, work your way to the apex of the boulder using a few crimps and jugs. The crux is low on the route.

I, of course, am not the FA of this route as I am sure it has been done many many times. If you have any info, please reach out, so we can add it here.
content.protection: There are rocks so a pad is nice. A spotter could be helpful as the bushes are near to the boulder on this side.
content.location: Find the two pockets low on the South Face. The route starts at the left of these pockets.

content.description:
I'm not local, so this may be a climb amongst locals already, but here it is:

Start on a low sidepull and a half-pad crimp on the north east corner of the boulder. Bump out to a better sidepull, then do the crux move to the second spike-shaped hold. Get another left sidepull, go up to a shallow left crimp, then go for the top. The holds are small, but the angles and feet are good. So I'd say V4-5, but again, I'm not local.
content.protection: Have a pad for the exposed rock on the ground and maybe a spotter to keep you out of the brush.
content.location: It is on the northeast corner of the boulder.

content.description:
This problem is described in the AC comment to the main page, but it's confusing now that there are more than two photos.

Walk uphill from Mongoose, find the slightly overhanging east face with a bad landing.  The lower you start the harder.  Side-pull and crimp until you can throw for the nice sloping ledge right below the top of the boulder.

Also, a V1 takes the line to the right of the bad landing, and the south face has some fun V2 ish moves on a steeper overhang.
content.protection: Pad or two, spotter.  Watch out for the rocky landing.
content.location: The boulder just uphill and west of Mongoose, main problem.
